intro: Hieracium bupleuroides subsp. calathodiiforme, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It is native to parts of Europe and has been introduced to other regions, often becoming a weed in disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the hawkweed genus, with a morphology adapted to thrive in various environmental conditions.
